author: Tom Reed
title: Smart Contract Development Campaign
description: User awareness, adoption, reduce barrier to entry. There are not as many people aware of smart contracts, their use and how to develop them.

assessments.note: boiler plate suggestions, not backed with any data. solution does not address necessarily the problem statement.
The proposal is very broad, generic, and no specific details are mentioned in the proposal
The proposal doesn't seem to justify the funds. and seems to simply duplicate current IOG work
The proposal does not provide specifics about the components of its solution, though it does generally address capabilities that would enhance the developer ecosystem and adoption.

Potentially a good idea - but far from what we can work with. The end of paragraph actually states it needs more work. I agree - before we can consider this for funding - community needs to understand how exactly this proposal aligns with mission and goals of what we are trying to achieve. Tying that all together in a more vivid fashion would have helped. But I am afraid - even so - at this point it needs much work. Maybe in later rounds with another form?

Given experience might be summerised with submitter statement : "I just found out about this request for ideas today, so this is all off the top of my head. I am sure in a brain storming session, a lot more great ideas and direction would come out of it.

Requested funds in USD 400000"
As there is no mention of how would the implementation happen, Or who'll be the team behind it and relative experience mentioned in the proposal doesn't look sufficient.
The proposal is not clear enough on the path towards developing campaigns and maybe bringing examples forward.
The proposal team lacks demonstrated experience in developing educational materials for Cardano.

I am unsure whether this is a typo or this proposal is really asking for full amount of the challenge to the tune of 400k? Apart from the fact that makes no sense whatsoever - I struggle to understand why this would be the right figure and where we can find some breakdown of thoughts on this. There is no indication of how these funds are going to be utilised in any coherent manner. There also is lack of establishing validity of experience claims. There is github page but it is very fresh and there isn't any other professional reference, past projects, etc. that we could examine and lean onto. Adding these elements could elevate the proposal legitimacy - but at the current condition - it is not investable by any means.
none provided. no justification of requested funds, usage, milestone, timeline, deliverables...
Very fewer details about what components or tools will e built to help create a better development ecosystem for cardano, and no details of fund breakdown
No criteria for evaluation of how the funds were used it clear.
The proposal does not provide a quantitative justification of its budget.

There is no sense of executable milestones/roadmap in a timescale that would make sense. Hopefully, the author can add elements like these as well as outlining how they think about success, or if they foresee any challenges/risks. None of these are present which makes it very difficult to assess - the whole merit. Maybe mentorship program could be a way how to improve it.

solution: First, build a friendly, process for education of smart contracts, use-cases and their development. Second, develop SDKs and/or transpiler..
experience: I have been a programmer and software engineer since 1995. I was first exposed to bitcoin and began mining it in 2010.
